results.title: Method study basic principles
results.brief_description: The systematic approach to method study — the essence of which lies in the critical questioning of existing procedures and which results in increased productivity, lower unit costs, easier work and higher earnings. Case examples come from garage work, furniture and electrical manufacture and Local Government.

results.title: Meteorites, asteroids and comets
results.creator_credit: Coastal Community Colleges and David P. Stone
results.brief_description:
Episode number 25 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
Meteorites have crashed to the Earth since time began with massive craters proving this, although scientists initially found it difficult to believe. Once it was determined that the rocks were “out of this world”, serious study was given to the phenomena. The location of the asteriod belt between Mars and Jupiter implies the existence of a now disintegrated planet. These asteriods are composed of three types: silicate, metal and carbon based. Comets have always been seen as “emissaries of chaos”. Halley’s Comet has offered scientists a chance to study this celestial body, which is largely an ice ball on an orbit through space. Comets have been known to cause destruction upon impact, and scientists believe that such a collision, which would result in mass devastation, may have explained the sudden extinction of dinosaurs on Earth. The likelihood of such an event re-occuring is also discussed.

results.title: Metamorphs: 1st year Swinburne Multimedia Design Project
results.brief_description:
A selection of animated morphs created by nine students in their first year Multimedia course, Faculty of Design, Swinburne University of Technology.
The students are: Alicia Braumberger, Andrew Coles, Matthew Robinson, Michael Yates, Oliver Pauliczek, Reif Campling, Richard Osellame, Steven Donnet and Yudy Chainy.
Includes a single split-screen edited trailer and a full version of each of the nine morphs created by the students.

results.title: Metamorphosis of the cello
results.brief_description: When a sensitive and accomplished musician plays on such a beautiful instrument as this cello, there comes into being a creation of beauty - music whose power stirs our emotions. what causes this effect - the composer, performer or craftsman who made the instrument? This portrait if the cellist and the history of the cello itself corresponds with the different movements of the music played.

results.title: Metamorphoses (K)
results.brief_description: An animated film about a clown who is so versatile that he even juggles himself. One moment the clown stands tossing balls, the next he becomes dismembered, following the balls about on the screen but coming together again all in one piece to finish the act. The film is in the genre of Norman McLaren and is without words.

results.title: Metamorphoses
results.creator_credit: Barry Greenwald, Faroun Films and Conestoga College
results.brief_description: A bored white collar office worker finds meaning in the 25 second elevator ride to his office. In this secret time alone, he progresses from simply undressing to his shorts (and then re-dressing) to a multitude of relaxing pass-times, all at ultrafast speed. One day the lift gets stuck and later opens to reveal a much older man apparently dead of old age. (Won Palm D’Or, Cannes, 1976.)

results.title: Metamorphic rocks
results.creator_credit: Corporation for Community Television and Robert Lattanzio
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “Earth revealed”.
The process of metamorphism changes the structure and composition of rocks; an atomic shuffling which results in change. Metamorphism for example is responsible for changing limestone into marble. There are two types of metamorphism; contact metamorphism resulting from a cooling process and regional metamorphism which is the result of tectonic activity. As a consequence of this process, many rare minerals can be formed.

results.title: Metals & plastics
results.brief_description: Looks at the history, properties, advantages and uses of plastics, and iron and its derivative steel. Examines how the properties of polymers from which plastics are built up affect their use.

results.title: Metals
results.brief_description: Sir Lawrence Bragg shows the different properties of metals, illustrates their characteristics, demonstrates the crystalling structure of aluminium, and shows how the same piece of metal can have different properties according to treatment. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
